intro: Selinum argenteum, commonly known as silverleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silvery-white, fuzzy foliage and yellow button-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its aromatic properties make it both visually appealing and potentially useful in herbal remedies.
